title: Companion type for Futura based logo
content:
Hello,

I am designing a logo for a photographer friend of mine.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100925061236im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gros_5369.jpg)

We ended up with a Futura Bold based logo and I am finding it hard to find a good **serif** based companion typeface for use on his business cards etc.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

Thanks.  
Demetre
author: wonderfulunion

comments.content: Why not just stick with Futura if you're looking for a sans. It's not always a good idea to pair more than one sans. Futura can be hard to read for long texts but for business card/letterhead type it should be OK. Alternately, perhaps try a serif?
I second Patty's motion. You've got a great logo there and it makes perfect sense to just carry on using Futura.

Looks like I made a mistake when posting this. I actually meant to put that I was looking for a serif typeface to contrast the sans.

I was told by a friend to investigate some serifs that originated around the same time as Futura but I'm not sure if that's the way to go with a more modern looking logo.

Any "serif" suggestions?
Trajan small caps, requiem, mrs eaves,bembo... STOP :)
